result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sidney S. Daniels Jr.

records.addlTxt: 3:03 PM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels Jr. appeared by video, in custody from FC jail.  Attorney Robert A Kennedy Jr. in court for Sidney S. Daniels Jr. State calls first witness, Det. Sgt. Michael Short. Sworn in, 3:04 PM. State directs. Record reflects proper identification of the defendant, 3:12 PM. Kennedy cross-examination of witness, 3:14 PM. Redirect by the State, 3:16 PM. Witness excused. Court finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Based on assumption that the information will mirror. Kennedy waives reading, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas. Court accepts pleas of NG, instructs the state to file information within 24 hours, continues bond and has set for JT.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment on June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:52 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Robert A Kennedy Jr. in court for Sidney S. Daniels Jr. Kennedy has went over complaint, asks for PH and will waive time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived, has PH scheduled and continues bond.
Preliminary hearing and Arraignment scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 16, 2022 at 10:45 am. Rescheduled to the above date and time per request of attorney.

10:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels Jr. appeared by video, in custody, FC jail. Court reviews file. Daniels indicates he has paid Attorney Kennedy. Court - Kennedy has not filed a notice of appearance, called the case early as there was not an attorney listed, instructs Daniels to contact Attorney Kennedy, will have set for another AIA and continues bond.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 15, 2022 at 09:45 am.

10:31 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels Jr. appeared by video.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court, in custody. Appearing specially today is Attorney Robert Kennedy Jr. - not officially retained yet. Daniels has complaint. Kennedy states the issue with getting retained/retainer fee, technically not representing him at this point. Daniels states that the papers are signed and money is ready. Court continues bond, sets for AIA on 6/8/22 at 11:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 8, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:44 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sidney S. Daniels Jr. appeared by video. Also appearing today is Attorney Robert Kennedy Jr, not yet retained on the matter - working on payment arrangements. Court will set for another AIA, when Attorney Kennedy is retained - will then set for PH, continues bond, set for AIA on 6/1/22 at 10:30 AM. If the AIA would turns into a PH - let State know so that they can subpoena their witnesses. Kennedy understands.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on May 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.

09:45 AM Defendant Sidney S. Daniels appears by video, in custody from FC jail.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sidney S. Daniels received complaint yesterday. Court reads charges and penalties. Daniels understands, has contacted a couple of attorneys, they have not gotten back to him yet. Court advises of options for obtaining an attorney, SPD, private hire or court appointed if not eligible. Daniels understands. Court - bond has been set at $5000 cash, will continue and has set for AIA.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 10:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Sidney S. Daniels Jr.
